meanings.definition: To dissect or analyze the structure of something, especially a body or organism.
meanings.sent1: The scientist will anatomise the frog to understand its internal organs.
meanings.sent2: Doctors often anatomise cadavers to learn about human anatomy.
meanings.sent3: During the biology class, the students had to anatomise a fish, which was quite an interesting experience.
meanings.sent4: She decided to anatomise the problem, breaking it down into smaller parts to find a solution.
meanings.sent5: The detective had to anatomise the crime scene to uncover the truth.

meanings.definition: To examine or study in detail.
meanings.sent1: The teacher will anatomise the poem to help the students understand its meaning.
meanings.sent2: Researchers often anatomise data to draw meaningful conclusions.
meanings.sent3: The children wanted to anatomise the mysterious box they found in the attic.
meanings.sent4: She would anatomise every word of the contract before signing it.
meanings.sent5: The artist would anatomise each brushstroke in the painting to appreciate its beauty.
